alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Sebastian (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 2:59AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Crawford, northwestern Sebastian, southwestern Washington, Sequoyah, southeastern Adair and northeastern Le Flore Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 258 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles east of Stilwell to 5 miles southwest of Short to 2 miles west of Sallisaw. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Sallisaw... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Alma... Barling... Pocola... Muldrow... Roland... Lavaca... Spiro... Arkoma... Bonanza... Gans... Marble City... Chester... Moffett... Rudy... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 15. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 302 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
